title: test_AnnexRepo_addurl_to_file_batched fails on bots
body:
#### What is the problem?
I think it is a "flaky" test which keeps from time to time failing on buildbots, like now on nd16.04 
http://smaug.datalad.org:8020/builders/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd16_04/builds/3155/steps/nosetests/logs/stdio
for https://github.com/datalad/datalad/pull/3036 while passing elsewhere

```shell
======================================================================
ERROR: datalad.support.tests.test_annexrepo.test_AnnexRepo_addurl_to_file_batched
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nose/case.py", line 197, in runTest
    self.test(*self.arg)
  File "/home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd16_04/build/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 411, in newfunc
    return t(*(arg + (d,)), **kw)
  File "/home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd16_04/build/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 523, in newfunc
    return tfunc(*(args + (path, url)), **kwargs)
  File "/home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd16_04/build/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 584, in newfunc
    return t(*(arg + (filename,)), **kw)
  File "/home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd16_04/build/datalad/support/tests/test_annexrepo.py", line 959, in test_AnnexRepo_addurl_to_file_batched
    ar.add_url_to_file(testfile, testurl, batch=True)
  File "/home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd16_04/build/datalad/support/gitrepo.py", line 228, in newfunc
    return func(self, file_new, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd16_04/build/datalad/support/annexrepo.py", line 1907, in add_url_to_file
    % (url, str(out_json)))
AnnexBatchCommandError: AnnexBatchCommandError: command 'addurl'
Error, annex reported failure for addurl (url='http://127.0.0.1:40293/about.txt'): {'command': 'addurl', 'file': 'about.txt', 'success': False}
```
I think it might be just our need to enable retries for annex gets for http: https://github.com/datalad/datalad/issues/2896
